column4: How long have you been running the desktop version?
well, i'm talking about doing this from a server
Like kauer said, explain more clearly.
i installed ubuntu 7.04 on this server, and removed X11
but it still has ubuntu elements in it, and i would like to clean things up.
Uhg. Well I guess it would be possible to install ubuntu-server, and then remove all packages that ubuntu-server doesn't depend on...
You'd need to reboot anyway, as the server runs a different kernel.
There's no way you can run an ubuntu-server install without at least rebooting once.
ubotu is a bot, not a person.
I know, I was the one calling it.
I already said that to him...
